phrases: Somehow, I...
No, sometime during summer vacation I will write an interesting name.
Miyoshi received a response from a company, asking her to write more of her cell phone novel.
Is not it natural to want to be with someone you like?
Like I said, you and Azuki are not normal.
Time's up.
Shuujin.
Starting now, I am drawing manga on my own.
Eh?! W-Why?!
You should not have to ask why.
If you are trying to become a mangaka, you need to honor your deadlines.
Yeah, but...
Saikou...
Okay, I will take it back.
I do not really like the idea of you and Miyoshi being there alone.
Saikou, in that respect, you have got the wrong idea.
Miyoshi's presence was not the reason why I could not write a name.
It was the other way around.
The other way around?
Yeah, I thought that if I got serious with Miyoshi, it would definitely make me want to sell even more.
I also thought it might even be a good idea not to meet until our dreams come true, like with you and Azuki.
Love comes in many forms.
At first, I was not doing this for a girl, but now I think I am the same as you.
Really?
Then I guess I did have that part wrong...
Sorry.
But in that case, you really cannot be late.
Yeah.
I am definitely going to be the original story author of a manga.
Even if I need to pair up with someone besides you, Saikou.
The artwork in your names really sucks, Shuujin, so tell me when you finish and I will do a good copy for you.
If you give it to somebody else, they will not have a clue what is going on in it.
Seriously?
But I will charge you 100 yen a page.
Okay, thanks.
Also, if I do something alone, is it okay for me to change the pen name from Ashirogi Muto to Ashiro Muto?
Is it okay?
If you are writing alone, then just use Mashiro Moritaka.
No...
Okay, I am fine with it then...
What are you two doing?!
The new term's opening ceremony is starting soon!
Well, why are you here?
I was up so late thinking that I overslept!
Man, that is lame.
See ya Saikou, let us both do our best.
Y-Yeah.
What about Mashiro?
He is fine, let us just go.
Eh?!
That is not good at all!
It is my fault for not honoring my deadline, so it cannot be helped.
Is it my fault?
No!
It is, is not it?
Because you were spending so much time with me over summer vacation...
I am telling you, that is not why!
We may have been together, but I was thinking of the scenario for the manga the whole time.
But then if you just explain it to Mashiro like that, I am sure he will understand!
I will go tell him that
Stop it!
Do not go making excuses to Mashiro for me!
And not to Azuki either!
It is my fault, so do not go butting in.
I cannot!
Saikou knows it was not your fault!
But it is not like it is all over!
I am still going to be an original manga story author!
And Saikou's still going to be a mangaka!
I like you, so I am going to keep working hard.
I still can!
When I said that, even Saikou understood.
Because you like me?
Yeah.
I am going to keep doing my best for your sake.
But if you say something unnecessary to Saikou or Azuki, I am sure I will not like you anymore.
But...
You want to do it alone?
Did you two have a fight or something?
We are not little kids.
It is not a name, just a plan for the setup.
Here.
A con man and a detective...
He sets traps for the culprits in order to bring out the truth, huh?
If you do this kind of mystery story right, it really will be interesting.
No, for this kind of story in particular, we really need Takagi-kun's power, do not we?
Have you given up on doing a mainstream battle manga?
I think that is a kind of mainstream story too.
Yeah.
It certainly is mainstream, and a kind that Ashirogi Muto is more suited to.
I drank a little too much coffee.
I am going to the bathroom.
Okay.
Takagi-kun, it is Hattori.
Why did you break up your team?
Mashiro-kun would not say.
It is my fault.
I could not keep my promise to write a name by the end of summer vacation.
Is that the only reason?
Mashiro-kun sure is strict.
That is just how serious he is.
And I did not think I was suited to battle manga from the beginning,
but Mashiro was fixated on doing a battle story, so we had that conflict of opinions too.
So this time, I am writing a mystery story.
A mystery story?
Ah, yes.
And uh, you will look at the name if it is just me right?
Yes, I will look at it.
Of course.
So...
Mashiro-kun does not know you are drawing a mystery story?
I could not tell him that I am ignoring his wishes and writing something different.
I was planning on having it done by the end of summer vacation, but I could not make it in time.
So I am setting my sights on being an original story author by myself.
What is with these two?
If I tell Takagi-kun what story Mashiro-kun is trying to do, then...
No!
Got it, a mystery story sounds good.
It really fits you, Takagi-kun!
Get that name in soon.
Well, even though I would like to get it done soon...
I still do not have the setup plan for the protagonist done yet.
The protagonist can just be an ordinary detective.
The important things in a mystery story are the tricks and mysteries.
It will be okay.
You have talent, Takagi-kun.
I am always telling you that even the editorial department has acknowledged that, are not I?
You need to have confidence.
Ah, okay.
Yuujirou, CROW has the opening pages for issue 49.
Ah, okay.
Oh, this is perfect, Fukuda-kun.
You are at Niizuma-kun's place now, right?
Could you put him on for a minute?
What do you mean, This is perfect?!
Ah sorry, that was a little rude.
Could you just fax me your name, Fukuda-kun?
You only want to do it in person?
You really are as much of a smart-ass as ever, Fukuda.
But I am going to be around there...
Sorry to keep you waiting.
Ah, no problem.
This is really good.
Could you make it into a name?
Your biggest weapon is your artwork, after all.
So try to come up with drawings that really fit this story.
Okay.
Huh?
You are alone today?
Do not tell me your team broke up?
Ah, am I right?
It is Mashiro-kun, right?
The one who does the drawing?
I actually happen to be looking for someone
to do the artwork for the second-place prize winner of the Story King for the name category.
You would be great for
Please do not screw around!
What is going on over there?
Woah, that was scary.
I am going back to work.
Sorry for yelling.
Ah, I do not mind.
The runner-up Story King.
If you did the artwork for that, you might really get popular.
If it is popular, it will naturally get serialized.
Did you want to do that?
Eh...
If you really want to do it, I do not mind apologizing and going to ask.
If I get popular, I will get serialized...
If I get serialized...
But if you do do that, you would better assume you will not be teaming up with Takagi-kun again.
Would you still do it?
Team up with me and we will become mangakas.
I am doing the artwork and he is doing the story.
Fu-sion-ha!
Let us keep going nonstop until we are done!
Okay!
All right!
Thank you, Saikou.
I do not know...
I still do not know what I should do...
If you are still half-hearted about this,
I do not think you should do the artwork for a name by anyone besides Takagi-kun yet.
Okay...
Ah, Takagi-kun?
Sorry it is so sudden, but do you think you could come in tomorrow?
I actually wanted to talk about the scenario with Mashiro-kun.
If you could answer me honestly, do you not want to be teamed up with him anymore?
It is not like that.
I am the one who invited him to become mangakas together.
I want to do it together.
I see.
But it is my fault things got like this.
Anyhow, I am still working hard,
and it is something I think might be good enough to get Mashiro to say himself that he wants to team up again.
If I can get it done before Mashiro-kun gets serialized by himself...
Yes, I see.
Then do you think you could leave that part to me?
If you listen to what I say, I am sure you will get back together and I bet you will have a hit manga.
The truth is that you and Mashiro-kun are precisely in tune with each other even now.
Enough so that even if you wanted to separate from each other, you could not.
I do not really understand...
Right now, Mashiro-kun is trying to write a detective story of his own.
Hattori-san, did you tell Mashiro-kun what I said I was trying to write?
No, I was surprised too.
Two people who would said they would split up had separately started working on the same kind of story.
So then...
Do you think you could hide the fact that you are doing a mystery story up until right before you graduate high school?
No, actually, do you think you could write a name for the story that Mashiro-kun is trying to do?
Hide?
Mashiro-kun is always in a rush to get serialized, is not he?
But a detective story is something you should really take your time with.
So let us take two years and we will polish up a really good name together.
But would not that mean deceiving Mashiro?
The way Jack works right now is if something is popular as a one-shot, then it is Yes, serialize it.
Or if it is sent to a serialization meeting and just three chapters are interesting, then it is also Yes, serialize it.
Of course, this is limited to works that can survive to the point of being a new series.
It is especially hard for newcomers.
I have thought for a while now that it is better to take your time on something you want to do.
And if you choose to do that strategy, you would be the only ones doing it.
They say that with a battle story you cannot wait more than half a year, but with a detective story it is different.
Take two years and diligently make up a name,
have Mashiro-kun draw that,
and I am sure you can make something amazing!
There is not any real point to getting serialized while you are still in high school, is there?
So you may as well take your time here to build up your strengths.
I will hold Mashiro-kun back from joining up with someone else or getting serialized alone.
I cannot.
If Mashiro-kun can get serialized on his own, he should be serialized then should not he?
I talked about this with Mashiro-kun yesterday,
but he looked like he was thinking deep down that he really wanted to be teamed up with you, Takagi-kun.
And as proof of that, he turned down doing the art for the runner-up Story King.
Then would hiding from Mashiro-kun that I am writing a mystery manga really...
I told you, Mashiro-kun would want to rush it toward serialization.
I am telling you that for his sake...
No, for both your sakes.
You should prepare a well-honed name.
All right then, the detective story that Mashiro-kun was working on was
Please stop!
If I heard that, I would end up writing a name matching the protagonist that Mashiro-kun thought of...
Alone, with my own skill, I will win the Story King or whatever it takes...
and if at that time Mashiro still says that he is okay with joining up with me, then I will!
Takagi-kun...
You are right...
What you said was more logical.
What I said might have been a case of an adult getting his thoughts twisted...
Sorry, I will be awaiting an interesting original story.
Okay...
That is plenty.
Now even if Takagi-kun hears from Mashiro-kun about him writing a detective story,
he definitely will not tell him that he is drawing one as well.
He will draw an interesting name no matter what it takes.
I really cannot get over how you two split up.
Miyoshi?
If it will get you two to make up, I will do whatever it takes.
We are not really in a fight.
I do not care, just name it!
I will seriously do anything!
Sorry, there is really nothing you need to fix.
Man, names really are hard to do.
Shuujin's amazing, how does he always do this?
How do I write names?
Yeah, please tell me!
First, compose the general idea in your mind,
then write out the script, and then divide it into panels so it fits the number of pages?
Yeah!
I watched him work on it on his computer all summer vacation, so I am totally sure!
Eh, what is wrong?
Shuujin did all that hard work and he still could not do it...
Can I really do this?
If you think you cannot, then why not do it together
No, I am still going to do it.
I decided to do this for Azuki's sake too!
I will do it no matter what!
No, that is why I said do it together...
You were on to something when you went home, but I have not heard any rumors.
Are you really doing it?
Ah, yeah.
Little by little, though.
Sounds good then.
I am doing a one-shot for the main magazine this time.
I sent in a name for serialization, but it was a no go.
They said to run it as a one-shot first.
That editorial department never knows real talent when they see it.
But that is really amazing, to be running in the main magazine and all.
Congratulations.
It are not all that great.
If it does not get popular, my serialization name's nothing.
Oh, and Nakai-san's really gotten into it.
I do not really get what they are about, but the drawing's he is doing are not like name drawings.
They are like friggin' paintings.
Flying apple skin!
It was only for a little while, but you worked with us.
You are now part of the Niizuma Group, no, the Fukuda Group.
So let us try our hardest to change Jack!
Fukuda Group?
See ya, and keep it up.
Okay, I will do my best.
Fukuda-san and Nakai-san are both pumping out names...
It was on late at night again, but Azuki became a regular on a second anime.
Can I...
really become a mangaka?
Huh?
They dissolved the team?
Sorry.
Takagi told me not to say anything, but... I...
Here.
100 yen a page, right?
I am trusting you to do good copies.
You finished a name?
I did five.
Five whole names?
That is incredible, I have not even finished one.
Detective?
What is this?
A name.
That is not what I meant, why is it a detective story?
Did you hear from Hattori-san I was doing a detective story?
Yeah.
But I heard it a month after I started on my detective story.
I have been working on it ever since I saw the cell phone novel site at Miyoshi's house,
and how they take mystery stories.
Oh yeah, it was on the day you called me at her house.
That is the day I quit as Eiji's assistant!
In fact, it is the same day I got the idea for doing a detective story!
The truth is that you and Mashiro-kun are precisely in tune with each other even now.
We sure are incredible.
We shifted in the same direction on our own on the same day.
What is up with that?
We look like idiots!
Seriously, hit me!
That Hattori-san sure is a schemer.
Yeah, but there was no way I could deceive you for two whole years.
And I would have to do it with Azuki and Miyoshi too.
But how do we tell Hattori-san?
I guess we just tell him the truth and go on like normal...
No, this kind of feels too convenient.
You got mad at me for not finishing a name by the end of summer vacation and it ended up like this.
To be honest with you, I was not really that angry.
Huh?
Really?
Yeah, I thought the reason why you could not finish the name was because you were playing around with Miyoshi.
But I know now that that was wrong.
I might have just been jealous of Miyoshi.
After what is happened today, I understand.
I need you, Shuujin.
Saikou?
So, how about we fool Hattori-san?
Fool him?
Hattori-san is having us write separately right now.
In half a year, we both tell him I have not finished a name yet.
And in that time we can do as much as we want.
Instead of doing the three names you need for serialization, we will do ten chapters.
I get it.
Hattori-san said to hide it for two years, but there is no way I could wait that long anyway.
Yeah.
It is true that it is better to take our time with a detective story, but two years is too long.
My plan is half a year.
We do not rush and we carefully work out the name in half a year together.
Ooh good, that sounds good!
We will deceive Hattori-san!
That is the specialty of the detective I came up with!
Huh, really?
We are even in tune on this sorta thing!
Then it is decided!
It is pretty different from Hattori-san's plan, though.
He said so himself, did not he?
Mangakas have to go higher than their editors!
That is true.
I guess our team was only dissolved for a month.
You do not think it was a little too fast?
It is fine.
There is no reason for us to work separately, is there?
Okay, if we have got that settled, let us head to the work place!
I want to see that deceptive detective you came up with!
Okay!
Hang on a second!
I want to talk with you two again!
Ashirogi Muto is two people in one, is not he?
We settled that.
The team is back on!
I guess we had you worried, huh?
What is with that?!
I was so totally worried!
Sorry.
We are headed to the work place.
I will treat you nice as an apology.
You want to come?
Sure!
What?
Well, I told Miho about your team breaking up.
Huh?!
I told you not to tell her!
But...
Miho was really worried this time.
But I told her not to butt in and say anything...
Mashiro?
I am sending her an email saying our team's back on and I am sorry for worrying her.
Send!
Woah, that was fast!
So, so, what did she say?
Well, I guess you can look.
What?
You and Miho talk about stuff like wavelengths?
That is hilarious!
Shut up.
Next, we are doing a detective story!
What did you think of my Toumei Tantei Skeleton?
A detective story is a great mainstream idea!
But what about my Skeleton?
Huh?
Next time, Cooperation and Conditions
I think dreams come in many forms.
